The basic tool ­here is the indifference curve, which shows the trade-­offs between two goods that would leave a consumer equally well off. In the basic diagram ­there are an ever-­ascending series of indifference curves, and the aim of utility maximization is to achieve the highest pos­si­ble indifference curve given one’s constraints.
